taskDescription: Aromatic compounds such as benzene react with alkyl chlorides in the presence of AlCl3 catalyst to yield alkylbenzenes. This reaction occurs through a carbocation intermediate, formed by reaction of the alkyl chloride with AlCl3 (R−Cl + AlCl3 ⟶ R+ + AlCl4−). How can you explain the observation that reaction of benzene with 1-chloropropane yields isopropylbenzene as the major product?
